titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The snow had mostly disappeared during the night, and the south wind blew softly inviting travellers to their venture. Jim & Clara went off in the motor after breakfast. I finished the sermon for Christmas Day, and attended Evensong. The Gows arrived at tea–time. He has become lamentably blind, & seems very depressed. After dinner I read aloud to the company.
